DT Article
TI Eutrichosomellini (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Aphelinidae) from India,
   with description of two new genera.
AU Hayat, Mohammad (hayat.mohd44@gmail.com) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 3821
IS 4
PS 425-442
PD Jun 24 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 3
AB Two new genera and four new species of the aphelinid tribe
   Eutrichosomellini (Chalcidoidea: Aphelinidae: Aphelininae) are described
   from India. These are Umairia Hayat gen. nov., Zubairia Hayat gen. nov.,
   U. laiba Hayat sp. nov., U. zeera Hayat sp. nov., Z. mirifica Hayat sp.
   nov., and Eutrichosomella veenakumariae Hayat sp. nov. Two of the
   species, U. laiba and E. veenakumariae, are reared respectively from the
   eggs of Papilio polytes L. (Lepidoptera) and cockroach oothecae
   (Blattodea). Keys to the genera of the tribe Eutrichosomellini, and to
   the Indian species of Eutrichosomella Girault are given.

DT Article
TI New neotropical species of Trupanea (Diptera: Tephritidae) with unusual
   wing patterns.
AU Norrbom, Allen L. (allen.norrbom@ars.usda.gov) 
   Estela Neder, Lilia
SO Zootaxa
VL 3821
IS 4
PS 443-456
PD Jun 24 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 11
AB Four species of Trupanea Shrank (Diptera: Tephritidae) with unusual wing
   patterns are described from the Neotropical Region: T. dimorphica
   (Argentina), T. fasciata (Argentina), T. polita (Argentina and Bolivia),
   and T. trivittata (Argentina). Celidosphenella Hendel, 1914 and
   Melanotrypana Hering, 1944 are considered new synonyms of Trupanea, and
   the following species are transferred from Celidosphenella to Trupanea:
   Acinia bella Blanchard, 1852; Acanthiophilus benoisti Seguy, 1933;
   Tephritis diespasmena Schiner, 1868; Celidosphenella maculata Hendel,
   1914; Sphenella poecila Schiner, 1868; Trypanea simulata Malloch, 1933;
   Trupanea stonei Stuardo, 1946; and Trypanea vidua Hering, 1942.
   Aphyllocladus spartioides Wedd. (Asteraceae: Mutisieae) is reported as a
   probable host plant for Trupanea dimorphica.

   Washington, DC, 20013, USA, USA.
EM allen.norrbom@ars.usda.gov

DT Article
TI A new species of lowland skink (genus Lipinia Gray, 1845) from
   northeastern Peninsular Malaysia.
AU Grismer, L. Lee (lgrismer@lasierra.edu) 
   Ismail, Lukman H.B.
   Awang, Muhammad Taufik
   Rizal, Syed A.
   Ahmad, Amirrudin B.
SO Zootaxa
VL 3821
IS 4
PS 457-464
PD Jun 24 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 6
AB A new species of scincid lizard, Lipinia sekayuensis sp. nov. from Hutan
   Lipur Sekayu, Terengganu State in northeastern Peninsular Malaysia is
   most similar to L. surda (Boulenger) but differentiated from it and all
   other species of Lipinia by having the combination of an adult SVL of
   42.3 mm; six supralabials; five infralabials; four supraoculars;
   prefrontals widely separated; two loreals; fused frontoparietals; lower
   eyelids bearing a large, transparent disc; 21 midbody scale rows; 56
   paravertertebral scale rows; 65 ventral scale rows; enlarged, precloacal
   scales; 10 subdigital lamellae on the third finger; 11, 15, and seven
   lamellae on the third, fourth, and fifth toes, respectively; distal
   subdigital lamellae keeled; a median row of slightly enlarged, subcaudal
   scales present; a generally unicolor, dark-brown dorsum bearing nine
   very faint, diffuse, darker stripes; and an external ear opening
   replaced by a scaly, auditory depression.
C1 Grismer, L. Lee; La Sierra Univ, Dept Biol, 4500 Riverwalk Pkwy,
   Riverside, CA, 92515, USA, USA.
EM lgrismer@lasierra.edu
RI Ahmad, Amirrudin B./W-3687-2018
OI Ahmad, Amirrudin B./0000-0002-7775-1289

   region; Eurasia; Asia

   Sauria, Scincidae

   Lipinia surda - Boulenger 1900 (Scincidae): [Diagnostic characters, P.
   460].

DT Article
TI Morphological and molecular characterization of Zygotylenchus gansuensis
   n. sp (Nematoda: Pratylenchinae) from China.
AU Wang, Honghong
   Zhuo, Kan
   Liao, Jinling (jlliao@scau.edu.cn) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 3821
IS 4
PS 465-475
PD Jun 24 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 1
U2 9
AB Zygotylenchus gansuensis n. sp. is described and illustrated from the
   rhizosphere of jujube (Zizyphus jujuba Mill.) based on morphology and
   molecular analyses. This new species is characterized by a low and
   flattened labial region with three annuli, stylet 14.1[plus or minus]0.5
   (13.0-14.9) [mu]m long, deirids absent, five lateral lines in the vulval
   region, pharyngeal glands overlapping ventrally or ventrolaterally, V =
   56.4[plus or minus]1.6 (54.0-60.8), indistinct spermatheca,
   subcylindrical tail with smooth and rounded terminus, and males absent.
   Molecular analyses show that the species has unique partial SSU, LSU
   D2D3 and ITS rRNA sequences. Phylogenetic relationships of Z. gansuensis
   n. sp. with other nematodes in Pratylenchinae are analysed using SSU and
   LSU D2D3.
C1 Liao, Jinling; South China Agr Univ, Lab Plant Nematol, Guangzhou,
   Guangdong, 510642, China, China.
EM jlliao@scau.edu.cn
SC Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Palaearctic region;
   Eurasia; Asia; China
DE Zygotylenchus gansuensis [Gansu /  / New species]. 
TN Invertebrates; Nematodes
ST Animalia, Nematoda
OR Zygotylenchus gansuensis (Nematoda): [Sp nov, Gansu, P. 466]. 
DI 10.11646/zootaxa.3821.4.5
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15010055147
DA 2020-09-17

DT Article
TI A new species of Hemiphyllodactylus Bleeker, 1860 (Squamata: Gekkonidae)
   from Pulau Enggano, southwestern Sumatra, Indonesia.
AU Grismer, L. Lee (lgrismer@lasierra.edu) 
   Riyanto, Awal
   Iskandar, Djoko T.
   McGuire, Jimmy A.
SO Zootaxa
VL 3821
IS 4
PS 485-495
PD Jun 24 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 6
AB A new species of gekkonid lizard Hemiphyllodactylus engganoensis sp.
   nov. from Pulau Enggano, southwestern Sumatra, Indonesia is
   differentiated from all other congeners by having the unique combination
   of a maximum SVL of 37.3 mm; six chin scales; no enlarged postmentals;
   five circumnasal scales; three or four scales between the supranasals;
   12 supralabials; 24 dorsal scales; 15 ventral scales; a lamellar hand
   formula of 4554 or 4454; a lamellar foot formula of 4555; four
   subdigital lamellae on the first finger; four or five subdigital
   lamellae on the first toe; a continuous, femoroprecloacal pore series of
   42; five cloacal spurs in males; no enlarged subcaudal scales; no dark
   postorbital stripes or striping on body; small dark blotches on dorsum;
   a yellowish postsacral mark bearing anteriorly projecting arms; and a
   pigmented caecum and gonads. Hemiphyllodactylus engganoensis sp. nov. is
   part of the speciose H. typus group.

   USA.
